description: From Anglo-Norman contributour (from Latin contribuō); equivalent to contribute +‎ -or.

entries.meaning: A benefactor; someone who donates to charity or some cause.
examples: I am a longstanding financial contributor to Amnesty International.

entries.meaning: A person who backs, supports or champions a cause, activity or institution.
examples: He was a regular contributor to Greenpeace protests.

entries.meaning: A person (or thing) instrumental in the creation or growth of something.
examples: With her strength and intelligence, she was an important contributor to the victorious effort.

entries.meaning: A person who produces articles published in a newspaper, magazine, online publication, etc.
examples: William Safire has been a notable contributor to the op-ed pages of the New York Times for many years.
